concordant.name: The Concordant Cities
concordant.description: A confederation of seven interconnected city-states that sit at major Resonance nodes on the Nexus plane. Their architecture constantly shifts as it incorporates elements from other planes during Resonance Events.

values.name: Harmony
values.description: Balancing the influences of all planes for the benefit of society.

values.name: Adaptability
values.description: Embracing change brought by Resonance Events rather than fearing it.

values.name: Knowledge
values.description: Understanding the patterns of Resonance to better predict and utilize them.

traditions.name: Attunement
traditions.description: A ritual tattooing process that helps citizens maintain their identity during plane shifts. The tattoos contain geometric patterns representing all five planes.
traditions.significance: Marks full citizenship and provides protection during Resonance Events.

traditions.name: Resonance Festival
traditions.description: A celebration held during major predicted Resonance Events, with music, dance, and temporary markets for cross-planar goods.
traditions.occasion: Major Resonance Events (5-7 times per year)
traditions.significance: Celebrates the unique nature of their fractured world and the opportunities it presents.

concordant.language_style: Formal with many technical terms related to planar phenomena. Contains words and sounds borrowed from all five planes.

naming_conventions.male: Melodic names with consonant pairs (Jaedin, Thaerol, Vestrian)
naming_conventions.female: Flowing names with multiple vowels (Aliora, Nyaeve, Seraphine)
naming_conventions.places: Often named after Resonance patterns or Luminary fragments (Harmonium, Echopoint, Luminfall)

verdant.name: The Verdant Collective
verdant.description: A nature-focused society that primarily exists in the Verdant plane but maintains outposts on Nexus. Their societal roles are seasonal, with individuals changing their functions throughout the year.

values.name: Symbiosis
values.description: Living in harmony with the natural world and each other.

values.name: Renewal
values.description: Embracing the cycles of growth, death, and rebirth.

values.name: Community
values.description: Prioritizing the needs of the collective over the individual.

traditions.name: Season Shifting
traditions.description: A ceremony where individuals transition to new societal roles based on the changing seasons.
traditions.significance: Ensures that everyone experiences different aspects of their society and prevents stagnation.

traditions.name: Green Speech Initiation
traditions.description: A ritual where new members learn the secret language of the collective, composed of plant growth patterns and pheromones.
traditions.occasion: Upon joining the collective or coming of age
traditions.significance: Allows communication that outsiders cannot decode, preserving the collective's secrets.

verdant.language_style: Soft spoken verbal language with many metaphors drawn from plant and animal life. Green Speech is non-verbal and uses pheromones and subtle manipulation of nearby plants.

naming_conventions.male: Names derived from plant species or natural phenomena (Alder, Rowan, Brook)
naming_conventions.female: Names derived from flowers or natural elements (Willow, Laurel, Dawn)
naming_conventions.places: Named after ecological features (Deeproot, Sunmeadow, Mistcanopy)

crystalline.name: The Crystalline Consortium
crystalline.description: A highly ordered society with the most stable presence on the Crystalline plane and trading enclaves on Nexus. Personal worth is measured by one's contribution to mathematical and magical precision.

values.name: Order
values.description: Maintaining structure, hierarchy, and predictability in all things.

values.name: Excellence
values.description: Striving for perfection in one's specialized field.

values.name: Legacy
values.description: Creating lasting works that will endure through time.

traditions.name: Faceting
traditions.description: A coming-of-age ritual where adolescents receive geometric crystal implants that enhance specific mental abilities.
traditions.significance: Determines one's specialized role in society and enhances natural talents.

traditions.name: Calculation Contest
traditions.description: Annual competition where individuals and teams solve increasingly complex mathematical and magical equations.
traditions.significance: Elevates social standing and determines resource allocation for the coming year.

crystalline.language_style: Precise and technical with minimal use of metaphor or ambiguity. Mathematical formulae are often incorporated into everyday speech.

naming_conventions.male: Geometric or mineral-based names (Hexar, Obsidian, Quartz)
naming_conventions.female: Gemstone or crystalline structure names (Sapphira, Amethyst, Lattice)
naming_conventions.places: Named after mathematical concepts or crystal formations (Dodecahedron, Fibonacci, Geode)

ashen.name: The Ashen Covenant
ashen.description: Nomadic societies traveling the Ashen plane with temporary settlements on Nexus. Their culture focuses on impermanence and rebirth, with no permanent ownership as possessions rotate through the community.

values.name: Impermanence
values.description: Accepting that all things eventually end and transform.

values.name: Memory
values.description: Preserving the wisdom and stories of those who came before.

values.name: Transformation
values.description: Embracing change and rebirth as natural and necessary.

traditions.name: Dust Keeping
traditions.description: The practice of preserving the ashes of ancestors and using them in rituals to communicate with the dead.
traditions.occasion: Death of community members and monthly remembrance ceremonies
traditions.significance: Maintains connection with ancestors and their wisdom, while honoring the cycle of decay and rebirth.

traditions.name: Possession Exchange
traditions.description: Periodic ceremony where all material goods are collected and redistributed among the community.
traditions.significance: Reinforces the concept that nothing is permanently owned, teaches detachment from material possessions.

ashen.language_style: Poetic with many euphemisms, especially regarding death and endings. Words often have multiple context-dependent meanings.

naming_conventions.male: Names related to fire or earth (Ember, Coal, Dust)
naming_conventions.female: Names related to transition or cycles (Twilight, Echo, Whisper)
naming_conventions.places: Temporary settlements named for events or omens (Ravenfall, Ashbloom, Veilbreak)

tempest.name: The Tempest Flotilla
tempest.description: A society constantly moving throughout the chaotic Tempest plane with harbors on Nexus during certain celestial alignments. They adapt rapidly to change with fluid social hierarchies that can transform daily.

values.name: Freedom
values.description: The right to change and choose one's path without constraint.

values.name: Opportunity
values.description: Seizing chances that arise from chaos and unexpected change.

values.name: Resilience
values.description: Weathering storms both literal and metaphorical with flexibility and strength.

traditions.name: Storm Binding
traditions.description: Capturing the essence of Tempest plane storms in tattoos that grant unpredictable magical abilities.
traditions.occasion: When an individual successfully navigates their first major Tempest storm
traditions.significance: Marks true membership in the Flotilla and bestows unique, often chaotic magical gifts.

traditions.name: Leadership Flux
traditions.description: A daily ritual where leadership positions are reassigned based on needs and circumstances.
traditions.significance: Ensures that those best suited to current challenges take command, prevents power entrenchment.

tempest.language_style: Fast-paced with many slang terms that change rapidly. Incorporates sounds mimicking wind and water. Tonal shifts indicate emotional context.

naming_conventions.female: Weather or energy-based names (Storm, Spark, Gale)
naming_conventions.places: Named after vessels or weather events (Thunderwake, Squallrider, Maelstrom)

metadata.description: Culture definitions for the RPG game world
